attributes.action: Lower the Voting Age to 15 so 15-17 year olds can vote.
attributes.background: I think that people aged 15 and above should have the right to vote in future Referendums and Prime Minister Elections. Young adults are taught in Schools about Politics and the Government so they will have a clear understanding of why and what they are voting for.

attributes.action: Make PM & Cabinet legally and personally liable for election promises.
attributes.background: As shown in the recent referendum, it has become too easy for campaign promises to be ditched and forgotten. That implies that victors are elected on platforms that they are not willing to or that are impossible to achieve. PM/Cabinet must therefore be held to account both as institution and person.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Create new Special Economic Zone for London, NI & Scotland which remains in EU
attributes.background: Although a majority of the UK voted to leave the EU a large majority of those in London, NI and Scotland voted to remain. These areas will suffer the most from the UK leaving the EU. Special Economic Zones have been created in many countries, including China, with much success.
attributes.additional_details:
We know the EU isn't perfect and needs radical reform but for many in the UK that doesn't mean we should leave it. This petition requests that the creation of a Special Economic Zone is discussed in Parliament. This Zone would remain a member of the EU and contain London, and perhaps other interested contiguous regions.

This SEZ would enable these regions to continue trading from within the EU thereby fostering increased trade, investment and job creation.

attributes.action: Review campaign rules / media regulation on stigmatisation of demographic groups
attributes.background: In the UK, loosely regulated media and political propaganda has been used extensively to stigmatise and marginalise demographics, particularly those in minority groups. More should be done to protect groups and individuals from becoming targets for political or financial gain.
attributes.additional_details: Media content and political campaigns, including headlines, tag lines, articles or information and imagery, specifically taken out of context or construed with the intention to promote concern, fear and isolation of any group or culture that exists fairly under UK law, should be regulated to protect the public from attacks of violence and hatred.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Make it an illegal offence for women to smoke/drink/use drugs whilst pregnant.
attributes.background: People know the risks of tobacco, alcohol and drugs, we all know the risks and dangers we're exposed to, we wouldn't dream of giving these to children, never mind newborn babies. So why do so many women continue to use these whilst pregnant? They are knowingly harming their unborn child.
attributes.additional_details:
Just like smoking and drinking, drugs have a major effect on a baby, the least of which is giving birth to a baby who is addicted to the drug. The consequences of using cocaine, for example, include heart attack, respiratory failure, strokes, and seizures, and all these life-threatening health problems can also be passed to an unborn baby.

All these products increase the risk of miscarriage, low birth weight, health complications and risks later in life, including mental health problems.

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence in PM Cameron post EU referendum.
attributes.background: In the event of a leave majority in the forth coming EU referendum we the people request that all Members of Parliament be made directly aware by the House of Commons Speaker to the announcement of our desire for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister David Cameron.

attributes.action: Boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background:
After the violence and racism by Russian supporters in the Euro 2016 football tournament in France. 
I would like the Government Ministers to boycott anything to do with the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
attributes.additional_details: If our government can do this. It will show they are looking out for the safety of the British Citizens which would be at risk if they were to fly out there. And with Government support, the British people, FA, World Cup sponsors and other qualifying countries may consider boycotting the tournament as well. Our Gouvernment needs to show it will not support at tournament that was won on bribes and cannot promise the safety of the British public.

attributes.action: Make vaccine inserts mandatory to receive before being given any vaccination.
attributes.background: This isn't about being pro or anti vaccinations. This is about knowledge and being able to make an informed choice in whichever choice you choose.
attributes.additional_details: By reading the vaccine insert it will help educate the person on the possible adverse reactions, it will help parents notice vaccine damage a lot earlier if it arises, you will be able to read the study details and see all ingredients in the vaccination before deciding to go ahead with them.

attributes.action: Deploy warships in the English Channel to stop and deter illegal migrants.
attributes.background: Over the past few weeks there have been known several incidents of illegal migrants trying to cross the English Channel to get in the UK. So far only one of the attempted crossings have been successful but it is inevitable that more will get into the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
For too long, the UK has been lenient when it comes to illegals trying to get into our nation and we must set an example to defend ourselves from possible terrorists posing as migrants (as seen during the Cologne and Paris attacks). And also to prevent further actual refugees from risking their lives trying to get into the UK.

I ask the Government to deploy warships into the English Channel to; stop and turn around illegals, deter further illegals from risking their lives in the effort to get into the UK, and if necessary use lethal force to defend British waters.

attributes.action: If Asia Bibi is executed we should 'cease trading' with Pakistan immediately.
attributes.background: Asia Bibi, a Christian, offered water to a Muslim woman. She refused as it had been handled by a 'dirty animal and dirty Christian'. She was found guilty of blasphemy and sentenced to death because she said 'Jesus may have a different viewpoint to Mohammed'.
attributes.additional_details: Daily Express 1 June 2016. Asia Bibi offered water to a Muslim woman who “I said ‘I think Jesus would have a different viewpoint to Mohammed’, the woman said ‘how dare you question the prophet, dirty animal’ and a 'dirty Christian'. She was found guilty by a Pakistan court of blasphemy and sentenced to death.This, by inference, is saying all Christians including our Queen as Head of Commonwealth and also Church of England is also. STOP trading, giving AID and eject from Commonwealth.

attributes.action: Advise China to make "Compassion for China's Animals" a recognised society.
attributes.background: China has no adaquate animal rights laws, the suffering animals endure there is not acceptable. "Compassion for China's Animals" is a group of activists taking positive steps to help dogs and cats caught up in the dog meat trade but they have no legal backing or government help. this should change
attributes.additional_details: "Compassion for China's animals" has successfully intercepted trucks carrying thousands of dogs in hell on earth conditions heading for slaughter and torture in unimaginable ways, however many of these trucks have been allowed to drive away as these wonderful activists have no government support and aren't recognised - they should be, they need to become, the much needed missing link in China's outdated and inadaquate animal rights laws, with powers of there own to monitor, enforce and amend laws

attributes.action: It is Now time to Abolish Abortions, 200,000 foetus murdered in the UK in 2015.
attributes.background: Since the Abortions were first legalised in 1967, approximately 22,000 abortions were carried out. This figure has increased over and beyond expectations. Time to Stop Abortions Now

attributes.action: Teach about the full LGBTQ* spectrum as part of the PSHE curriculum.
attributes.background: If the government made it mandatory for students to be taught about the LGBTQ* spectrum I feel it would drastically decrease bullying and ignorance, as well as making students possibly feel better about themselves if they understand that their feelings are normal.
attributes.additional_details: As a high school student myself I have noticed a distinct lack of education regarding LGBTQ* people, despite the fact that 1 in every 10 people is either lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender.

attributes.action: Change the railway lines for a faster train from Weymouth to London
attributes.background: The train takes 3 hours From Weymouth to London (138 miles) and it takes 2 hours 44 minutes from Liverpool to London (222miles).The old Victorian lines are not good enough for a faster train.

attributes.action:
Ban 0845 type numbers
Stop service providers charging customers contacting them
attributes.background:
Essential utility and service providers charge customers who need to contact them by phone
Identifying, reporting and resolving service delivery problems is an integral part of their business and should not constitute an additional source of revenue.
customer contact must be free - eg 0800 numbers
attributes.additional_details:
National service providers should provide customers who buy their utilities or products with free vectors of direct communication.  It is unethical to charge paying customers additional fees to speak to their service providers.
These, and other barriers to communication, serve to discourage customers from raising complaints and identifying problems. Opportunities for utility providers to monitor and maintain  service quality and delivery is therefore unfairly restricted and limited.

attributes.action: Cycling revolution will cure the nation’s poor health.
attributes.background: 67% of men and 57% of women in the UK are overweight or obese. Coronary heart disease , stroke, type 2 diabetes, colon cancer , breast cancer, osteoarthritis , depression , dementia are just some of the diseases that can be prevented/delayed by doing regular exercise...
attributes.additional_details:
Imagine how much money could be saved by the NHS (£115 billion spent p.a.) if the population was healthier. This money should be spent on the following:
-More bike stands throughout the UK, a significant increase in Boris bikes and the introduction of Boris bikes in every city in the UK.
-A mass education program about the benefits of cycling in primary schools, secondary schools, universities and work places throughout the UK.
-Cycling facilities (e.g. lockers, secure bike sheds, showers) in the locations mentioned above.
-Longer cycle superhighways in London and superhighways in every city in the UK.

attributes.action: Mandatory air rifle registration with a 2 year period to register.
attributes.background:
Make mandatory registration of air rifles.
Currently in the UK anyone can own an air rifle & use these to illegally shoot on lands without permission committing the acts of armed trespass and poaching.
Some shoot pets escape prosecution and costs owners thousands of pounds!
www.ukgunbook.com
attributes.additional_details:
By making registration mandatory ( 2 year period to register ) it will help solve crimes of pets that have been shot and / or killed.
It will also make sure that owners are punished for offences committed with their weapons.
We dont want to stop people shooting, we just want to ensure those that own weapons are using them sensibly, on lands with permission.
Similar to the UK Gunlaws on ShotGun ownership.
£15 per weapon registration and £10 per year renewal fees for up to 10 serialised weapons.

attributes.action: Debate the EU's Five Presidents’ Report & its likely impact on the UK.
attributes.background:
The report proposes the completion of Europe’s Economic, Monetary & Political Union.  It uses the terms 'euro area' and 'EU' in relation to its propositions; thus a likely impact on non-euro sovereign states such as the UK.
My concern is that our MPs are not fully aware of its content or impact.
attributes.additional_details:
The report can be accessed at: https://ec.europa.eu/priorities/publications/five-presidents-report-completing-europes-economic-and-monetary-union_en.
It states, 'And finally, towards a Political Union that provides the foundation - - - '. 
It uses doublespeak such as, 'The euro is a successful and stable currency', not withstanding the intractable problems a common currency has given countries such as Greece.

attributes.action: Hillsborough families compensated in full for 27 years of legal fees.
attributes.background: The Hillsborough victims families have for 27 years had to pay their own legal fees unearthing the truth of what happened on 15/04/89. The South Yorkshire Police and others held responsible for the tragedy that day have had their legal fees paid by the tax payer. Another miscarriage of justice.
attributes.additional_details: The families of the 96 people who died at Hillsborough have had to endure 27 years of pain and heartache uncovering what they always knew was the truth. The families themselves and campaign groups have had to find exorbitant amounts of money to fund a fight that should never have had to be fought whilst the establishment have continued to fund their cover up and lies fully funded by the tax payer.

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into privately contracted benefit assessments by the DWP
attributes.background: Channel 4 Dispatches has revealed a systematic agenda to cut benefit payments by Capita, contracted for the DWP for Personal Independence Payment assessments alongside Atos. There is evidence to suggest systematic fraud and abuse of vulnerable adults by these companies. We call for a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.channel4.com/info/press/news/the-great-benefits-row-channel-4-dispatches

attributes.action: Increase the resources allocated to child protection.  No more Ayeeshia's!
attributes.background: The case of Ayeeshia Smith is far from isolated. 1 child PER WEEK is murdered by their parent(s) in the UK. That simply has to stop. I'm calling on the Government to substantially increase the resources allocated to child social care and child protection, to try to make sure it never happens again
attributes.additional_details:
Ayeeshia Smith.  Baby Peter.
High profile names, for all the wrong reasons
But apparently, in the UK, one child per week is murdered by his or her parents.  Think about that: ONE CHILD PER WEEK KILLED BY THEIR PARENT(s).  Source:http://straightstatistics.fullfact.org/article/how-many-children-are-murdered-britain-every-year
In a supposedly civilised society, this simply cannot go on.  The government need to do whatever it takes - spend whatever is required - to make sure this never happens again

attributes.action: Government must provide Framework Documents on governance after EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Government provided the People of the UK with a referendum on whether they wish to stay in or leave the EU. The Government must therefore provide two framework documents that give clear guidance on how the UK would be governed under each option so that the People can reach a considered decision
attributes.additional_details:
Background information on why the Government should provide these two framework documents and the consequences if they do not, can be reviewed by the following link

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6nprf1f6wrth3bx/The%20forthcoming%20EU%20Referendum_Revision%201_Final%20Draft.pdf?dl=0

attributes.action: The UK to join the Eurozone
attributes.background: Without integration into the Eurozone the UK will always remain a fringe state of the European union, both economically and politically, with this integration tourism and trade between the other Eurozone countries will become more efficient and build stronger political ties with other major nations.

attributes.action: Force all motorcycle delivery riders to pass a full UK motorcycle driving test
attributes.background: Most delivery motorcycle riders are riding on L Plates. i.e. they have not passed a full motorcycle driving test. Their standard of riding is poor and they pose a high risk to other road users/pedestrians. They are using the roads for commercial purposes, they should be forced to pass a driving test

attributes.action: Ensure all Cafcass calls and meetings are recorded and both parties get a copy
attributes.background: Due to personal experience of having a Cafcass telephone interview not reflect my issues, I began to look at net mums and other site representative of both sexes and I've found many people found this happening. All calls and meetings should be recorded for safety to ensure key information is saved.
attributes.additional_details: Since most organisations like insurances record calls it seems a serious failing data gathered in the best interest of a child is not recorded. If a report does not reflect what a parent or other person says the recording could be sent to court to validate the person. A report missing key information causes distress and goes against the person as the court presume Cafcass to be efficient. Recording provides proof for all parties.

attributes.action: Tackle the pay gap between men and women.
attributes.background:
According to AAUW, the pay gap won’t close until 2152 - lets change that.
Why should women be paid 20% less than a man doing exactly the same job?
Please sign this petition and help us take one more step towards gender equality.

attributes.action: Review the Council Tax system so that it reflects individual contributions
attributes.background: I believe that the current Council Tax system is outdated and unfair - taxing households rather than individuals - Why should single households pay almost as much as a 5 occupancy household, why should a property worth millions pay same as a council flat?
attributes.additional_details:
Tax should be paid on individual bases and proportional to each person burden to the local authority - Should 2 pensionnaires household pay same council tax as a family of 5? Should a single working professional pay towards services it does not currently use?
Also with property valuation completely changed from 25 years ago - should household taxation still be considered an option? 
On top of that local councils have constantly risen tax/year and discrepancies between boroughs are huge.

attributes.action: Employment Support Allowance needs to be changed for people who work.
attributes.background: After being signed off work due to Mental Health problems, I was extremely disappointed to find out that after DWP checked my last twelve months National Insurance contributions I didn't qualify for Employment Support Allowance. In the past 18 months I have reduced my hours due to health problems.
attributes.additional_details: If people are suffering with accident/illness it is fairly common that may have  to reduce their hours to help them through. Therefore, it would be better to no longer use the time limit of twelve months to check NI Contributions when calculating if they qualify for Employment Support Allowance. It think its fair to say it would be better to look at what has been paid for all the years they have worked. This ruling needs to be changed to support workers who are going through difficult times.

attributes.action: Make compulsory DNA testing in order to reduce crime a law
attributes.background: dna helps the police find criminals faster and more efficiently. in order to do this they need to take one mouth swab sample of everyone in the country. This may have negative effects on example would be privacy. But would you give a sample of your dna to keep you and your friends and family safe.

attributes.action: Host a Referendum for an English National Anthem.
attributes.background: Our proposal of a public referendum would be an effective way of allowing the people of England to choose for themselves how they wish to express their identity in our family of nations. Just as Wales are permitted with Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau, and Scotland with Flower of Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: https://web.archive.org/web/20100615152120/http://www.weareengland.org/news.asp?itemid=327&itemTitle=England+announce+victory+anthem+for+Delhi+chosen+by+the+public%21&section=115&sectionTitle=News

attributes.action: Sellers should complete building survey before the property goes on the market
attributes.background: When selling a property the building survey should be completed by the seller before it can go on the market, so that all parties involved are aware of any serious defects.This would expediate the process for buyers, who often only discover the property's faults late in the process, but also sellers
attributes.additional_details: Although the current rules are supposed to offer protection, as Sellers are meant to inform Buyers of serious defects if a previous sale has fallen through etc this is often not enforced. Instead late in the process, after the Buyer has already paid for a host of surveys, the true cost of the property becomes apparent. Having the survey completed first would make everyone aware of all issues at the start of the process, making life easier for all involved.

attributes.action: Invoke NATO Article 4 consultation on establishing a "No-Fly" zone over Syria.
attributes.background: Syrian and Russian airstrikes target civilian population centres, schools and medical centres, weaponising refugees and making living in non government areas untenable. This not only constitutes a warcrime but effectively endangers NATO and EU cohesion, as a planned and desired secondary objective.
attributes.additional_details:
A "No-Fly" zone would force the Syrian and Russian regime to take the peace talks seriously, stop the scheduled and intentional murder of innocent civilians and allow for the implementation of much needed humanitarian aid. It would also be an effective first step in allowing Syrian refugees to return home.

Secondly we respectfully request that her Majesty's government petition the International Tribunal in the Hague to prosecute those who planned, ordered and willingly executed said warcrimes.

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Government inquiry in to the award of the 2016 East Anglian Rail Franchise.
attributes.background:
Despite abysmal performance and failing the customer for many years, Abellio have been rewarded the East Anglian franchise.

We call for a full pubic review into this decision and a reassessment of the competitive bids.

attributes.action: Prevent NHS basing eating disorder treatment on low BMI, by providing more funds
attributes.background:
Currently, when people approach GP's due to eating disorders, many are turned away due to not having a low enough BMI.
With increased NHS funding, people can be given access to the treatment they need before it's too late; radically reducing the number of lives lost due to these deadly illnesses.
attributes.additional_details:
B-eat, the leading eating disorder charity estimated that in 2015, 725,000 people in the UK were affected by eating disorders; with Anorexia nervosa having the highest mortality rate of all mental disorders. 

According to the NHS, 1 day, for 1 patient in hospital costs around £400. Therefore, money would be saved by giving people the access to treatment they need, before they reach the point of needing a hospital admission; which can last months.

attributes.action: Make the swegway/hoverboard no longer governed by the highways act of 1835.
attributes.background: The highways act of 1835 was clearly not written with the swegway in mind. They are smaller than a baby's pram and a disability scooter and people are allowed to use them in public, so it is unjust for the swegway to be singled out and banned in public places.
attributes.additional_details: At the very least they should be legal in public parks as bikes, being much faster than a swegway, are allowed to be in parks but swegways are not.

attributes.action: Allow Armed forces personal to carry side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.background: Due to the fact there gave been person's attempting abductions against our service personnel it is time to allow them to carry loaded side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.additional_details: RAF Marham. Aldershot

attributes.action: Make the government take a more active role in providing food for those in need.
attributes.background: We are campaigning on behalf of over 1.1 million people in the UK who have needed emergency food supplies from The Trussell Trust in the last year (1). Food bank usage is on the rise, but we believe it is the government's responsibility to provide food for their people, not that of the food banks.
attributes.additional_details:
The emergency food supplied by The Trussell Trust is estimated as less than half the number of the total amount of emergency food supplies distributed in the UK (2). However the government plan to cut welfare by £3bn by 2020 (2).

References:
1. https://www.trusselltrust.org/news-and-blog/latest-stats/#fy-2015-2016
2. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/food-bank-usage-at-record-high-reveals-trussell-trust-a6984921.html

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: Review on Police Cautions
attributes.background: Police Cautions are to be used as an alternative to prosecution in minor cases. However they are so frequently used that people who accept them are unaware of the future implications of having a caution. Regulations & review on the dispensation of a police caution and length on a record is required.
attributes.additional_details:
It has become increasingly apparent the implications of a police caution and unfortunately it is not realised until it is too late. The bodies able to dispense a caution, police and CPS, often work together and it is a biased system in that those who investigate also give the reprimand.
The following links shed some light on this matter.
http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-cautions-from-crb/
https://iaingould.co.uk/2013/06/03/a-caution-is-for-life-not-just-for-christmas/

attributes.action: Look to the future and make the UK an officially Athiest state.
attributes.background: Religion is a divisive influence on modern society. Blind faith and superstition is a mentality of the past. Atheism is our only chance for a successful globally united and peaceful future.  The U.K. should take the lead and show the way by not promoting ANY religion at state level.
attributes.additional_details: My references are religions complete lack of evidence.

attributes.action: Harsher penalties for racially abusing foreigners, blacks, Muslims and Asians.
attributes.background: Having seen people being racist and xenophobic towards foreigners, blacks, Muslims and Asians on the TV and in newspapers, it has angered me and I have had enough of it. I would like to see harsher penalties introduced to help reduce hate crime in the UK.

attributes.action: Issue a Travel Warning for the USA due to high gun crime and police brutality
attributes.background: Travel Warnings remain in place until situations change; some have been in effect for years. The ongoing police brutality and high gun crime in the USA is a potential threat to any tourist. Citizens should be advised of this danger and encouraged to avoid the USA until there are gun/police reforms.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all non-vehicular road users to wear hi-viz
attributes.background: In daylight or dusk, hi-viz is highly visible to road users.  To reduce the number of accidents on the road, we call for the Government to make it a legal requirement for all road users to wear hi-viz clothing including, but not limited to, motorcyclists, cyclists, runners, walkers and horse-riders.

attributes.action: Debate the UN report on human rights abuses and austerity
attributes.background:
The UN has produced a report which states the UK’s austerity policies are in breach of international human rights obligations.
The UN are “seriously concerned” by the state of inequality in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
UN report: E/C.12/GBR/CO/6
Download here:
http://tbinternet.ohchr.org/_layouts/treatybodyexternal/SessionDetails1.aspx?SessionID=1059&Lang=en

attributes.action: Move Cannabis to Class C and move it from a schedule 1 drug
attributes.background: Both of the current class and scheduling of cannabis are out of date, unscientific, completely against all evidence, have created enormous harm to society and has held back medical advances for over 45 years.
attributes.additional_details: The reclassification of cannabis from Class C to Class B was done as part of a deal made by Gordon Brown and the Daily Mail editor. This was done against the findings, research and recommendation of the ACMD. The schedule 1 status means that the drug has no medical value. This is completely wrong as it was still being prescribed as a medicine in the UK until 1971. Over the last 20 years there have been on average 2 published studies per day on medical cannabis. People are suffering as a result.

attributes.action: Parliament should set up an Office for Electoral Information Integrity.
attributes.background: In the modern age it is possible for all well intentioned MP's to sometimes present incorrect information or correct information in a misleading way. This erodes public confidence both in MPs as well as in the whole political system, which ultimately undermines democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The OEII would have the following functions:
1) define and publish standards for information impartiality and comprehensibility
2) provide advice to MPs on how best to present information in an impartial and generally comprehensible way
3) during the purdah period in the run up to elections or referenda, it would scrutinise information placed in the public domain by political parties or groups and would issue public statements describing how the presented information is deficient when needed.

attributes.action: To implement a Civil Law consequence to racist and xenophobic behaviour.
attributes.background: We need to promote tolerance and equality now more than ever. This proposal is IN ADDITION to The Equality Act 2010. A number of racist and xenophobic offences do not reach a conviction in court due to a lack of evidence. We propose that some incidences could be settled under Civil Law.
attributes.additional_details: Proposal: Party A is victim to racist or xenophobic behaviour by Party B. Party C is witness to the event and gives a statement. A document states Party A will not press charges if Party B agrees to pay a significant fine OR attends a Humanity awareness course which will aim to educate and promote tolerance and understanding. The course completion will be subject to the course provider certifying that party B demonstrated remorse and engaged with the subject matter.
